cards.name: Terramorph
cards.text:
Terramorph enters the battlefield as an island.
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose a basic land you control with a type different than Terramorph. If you can't, sacrifice Terramorph. If you do, Terramorph gains that basic land's type and loses all other basic land types.

cards.text:
Protection from colorless
{T}: Target creature gains protection from colorless until end of turn.
All other clerics get +1/+1.

cards.name: Archangel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.name: Shiva the Destroyer
cards.text:
Flying, defender
Shiva the Destroyer can't block white creatures.

cards.name: Medical Training
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has “{X}, {T}: Prevent X damage to any target. Spend only green mana to activate this ability.”

cards.name: Purification
cards.text: All non-land, non-artifact permanents are white. (They stop being any other colors.)

cards.name: Animate Walls
cards.text: Wall creatures can attack as though they didn't have defender.

cards.name: Faded Circle of Protection
cards.text: {1}: The next time a colorless source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Page's Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature<
As Page's Ward enters the battlefield and at the beginning of your upkeep, choose a color. Enchanted creature has protection from the last chosen color. This effect doesn't remove Page's Ward.

cards.name: Colorless Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from colorless and +1/+1.

cards.name: Hyperion
cards.text: {T}: Two target attacking and/or blocking creatures switch powers with each other until end of turn.

cards.name: Reflection
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage this turn, that damage is instead dealt to that source (if the source is a creature) or to that source's controller (if the source is a spell or other non-creature source).

cards.name: Sanctuary
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all damage to enchanted creature. It can't attack or block.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may attach Sanctuary to any target creature.

cards.name: Mass Resurrection
cards.text: All creature cards in your graveyard come into play under your control. When each such creature enters the battlefield, target opponent draws a card and gains 10 life.

cards.name: Yellow Elemental
cards.text: Protection from green and from white

cards.name: Eosian Stag
cards.text: All black creatures get -1/-1.

cards.name: Efficiency
cards.text:
If a creature dies with more than lethal damage marked on it (for example, a source deals 3 damage to kill a creature with toughness of 1, leaving 2 excess damage marked on it), Efficiency deals damage equal to such excess damage to the source of such excess damage (if the source was a creature) or to that source's controller (if the source was a spell or other non-creature source).
5/7

cards.name: Vicarious Entity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.

cards.name: Afterlife
cards.text: Each player exiles all creature cards from their graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures they control, then puts all cards they exiled this way onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Dawn of the Dead
cards.text: Each player puts all creature cards in their graveyard onto the battlefield under their control. Each creature put onto the battlefield this way is a black 2/2 zombie with no mana cost, but retains its other abilities and types.

cards.name: Ophion
cards.toughness: }: The next time target creature would die, instead exile that creature and its controller creates a 2/2 black Zombie creature token. When that token dies, put the creature from exile into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Horned Devil
cards.text:
{U}: Flying until end of turn.
{R}: +1/+0 until end of turn.
{B}: +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Satan's Reward
cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated. Each player gains life equal to the number of creatures they controlled destroyed this way.

cards.name: Starvation
cards.text: Each creature gets -X/-X, where X is the number of creatures controlled by that creature's controller.

cards.name: Elric's Oath
cards.text:
As Elric's Oath enters the battlefield, you lose life equal to your life total, and draw that many cards.
You have no maximum hand size.
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life. You can't gain life.
Whenever you're dealt damage, sacrifice that many non-token permanents. If you can't, you lose the game.

cards.name: Liquid Doom
cards.text: All green creatures get +2/-2.

cards.name: Thief of Baghdad
cards.text: {T}: Gain control of target artifact. Thief of Baghdad doesn't untap during your untap step as long as you control that artifact.

cards.name: Ice Fiend
cards.text:
Trample
Ice Fiend gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control.
Other creatures you control get -1/-1.

cards.name: Demon of Air & Darkness
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Demon of Air & Darkness deals 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Violet Elemental
cards.text: Protection from blue and from black

cards.name: Forbidden Knowledge
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has “{T}: Deal 2 damage to any target.”

cards.name: Total Recall
cards.text: Each player puts all cards from their graveyard into their hand.

cards.name: Screeching Meemies
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Screeching Meemies deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Python
cards.text:
Whenever Python blocks a creature, tap that creature and put a strangle counter on it, and tap Python. A creature is considered “prey” so long as it has any strangle counters on it. A prey doesn't untap during its controller's untap step. Python doesn't untap during your untap step if any prey are on the battlefield.
At the beginning of your upkeep, add a strangle counter to each prey, then each prey deals damage equal to its power to Python and Python deals damage to each prey equal to Python's power multiplied by the number of the strangle counters on that prey (the damage is dealt simultaneously).

cards.name: Graveyard Waltz
cards.text:
If a player would draw a card during their draw step and hasn't used this ability that turn, they may exile target instant or sorcery card from their graveyard instead.
Each player may cast the card they exiled with Graveyard Waltz that turn. If the card is cast this way and would enter a graveyard, exile it instead.

cards.name: Multichannel
cards.text: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 0 life the first time this turn, then 2 life any number of additional times this turn. For each time you do, add 1 mana of any color.

cards.name: Unnatural Selection
cards.text: Reveal the top card of your library. Play that card if possible. If the card is a spell, you may cast it without paying its mana cost. If it is a spell with {X} in its mana cost, you may pay additional mana for {X} when you cast it. If you can't play it, put that card into your graveyard.

cards.name: Lifebringer
cards.text:
Whenever Lifebringer deals damage to an opponent, you gain that much life.
{1}{B}{B}: Until end of turn, whenever you would gain life, you gain twice that much life instead. (If you activate this ability multiple times, the effect will multiply each time.)

cards.name: Heavy Crossbowman
cards.text:
{T}: Heavy Crossbowan deals 1 damage to any target.
{1}{R}, {T}: Heavy Crossbowman deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.name: Green Elemental
cards.text: Protection from green

cards.name: Mother Nature
cards.text:
All other green creatures get +1/+1.
{G}: +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Atlas
cards.text: You may plan an additional land on each of your turns.

cards.name: Some Enchanted Evening
cards.text: Change the text of each enchantment by doubling all numerals and number words in the text. (For example, “+2/+1” becomes “+4/+2,” “pay 1 life” becomes “pay 2 life,” “draw two cards” becomes “draw four cards,” etc. Ignore words like “a” and “the.” This effect doesn't change values of X, numbers in generic mana symbols, targets already previously chosen, or enchantment spells while they're on the stack.)

cards.name: Tinkerer
cards.text: Whenever an artifact spell you control resolves, you may pay {U}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Lifestealer
cards.text: {B}: Lifestealer gets +0/+3 until end of turn and deals 3 damage to target other creature you control. (You can only activate this ability if a valid target exists.)

cards.name: Moorish General
cards.text:
All knights get +1/+1.
As long as you control at least two plains, Moorish General has banding.

cards.name: Fiery Shrub
cards.text: All blue creatures get -2/+1.

cards.name: Orange Elemental
cards.text: Protection from red and from green

cards.name: Mind Twister
cards.text: Randomly assign control of all non-enchanted creatures, and tap them. (Exile all non-enchanted creatures face down, shuffle them, then deal each player the same number of cards as creatures they controlled that were exiled this way. Then reveal those creatures and tap them. They are not treated as entering the battlefield.)

cards.name: Simplicity
cards.text: All creatures lose all abilities and are colorless artifact creatures with base power and toughness 2/2.

cards.name: Stream of Consciousness
cards.text: Each artifact is an artifact creature with base power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (This includes artifacts that were already creatures. The artifacts retain their abilities.)

cards.name: Manipulation
cards.text: For each aura attached to a creature, you may attach that aura to another creature controlled by the same player. (Control of the auras doesn't change.)

cards.name: Lifegeyser
cards.text: Each player gains 100 life!

cards.name: Sheherazad
cards.text: Players play a Magic subgame, using their libraries as their decks. You go first. Each player who doesn't win the subgame loses half their life, rounded up.

cards.name: Psychic Storm
cards.text: Each player sacrifices half the permanents they control, rounded up. (You choose what to sacrifice first, then continue in turn order. Then everything is sacrificed simultaneously.)

cards.name: Mox Diamond
cards.text:
{T}: Add one-half mana of any color. (One-half unused mana deals one mana burn. Combining two half-mana of different colors results in one colorless mana.)
{3}: Untap Mox Diamond.

cards.name: Moonstone
cards.text: Activated abilities of artifacts cost {1} less to activate. If this would reduce the cost of an activated ability to less than {0}, then whenever that ability is activated, its controller adds {1}. (If multiple Moonstones are in play, the effect is cumulative.)

cards.name: Thought Stone
cards.text: Blue spells cost {1} less or {U} less.

cards.name: Earth Stone
cards.text: Red spells cost {1} less or {R} less.

cards.name: Pure Stone
cards.text: White spells cost {1} less or {W} less.

cards.name: Death Stone
cards.text: Black spells cost {1} less or {B} less.

cards.name: Life Stone
cards.text: Green spells cost {1} less or {G} less.

cards.name: Ring of Undoing
cards.text: {T}, sacrifice Ring of Undoing: Return two target other permanents you own to your hand. You can't activate this ability during the combat phase.

cards.name: Symbol of Pain
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Symbol of Pain deals 1 damage to each opponent.

cards.name: Symbol of Power
cards.text: Creatures get +1/-1.

cards.name: El Timtor's Tiny Staff
cards.text: All auras attached to creatures lose all abilities and have “Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.”

cards.name: Round Table
cards.text: All knights have banding.

cards.name: Ruin
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, for each creature you control, you may place a ruin counter on it or remove a ruin counter from it. A creature can't have more than one ruin counter on it.
If a source would deal damage to a creature with a ruin counter on it, prevent 1 of that damage. A creature with a ruin counter on it can't attack or block.

cards.name: Paxin's Armor
cards.text:
When Paxin's Armor enters the battlefield, you may attach it to any non-wall creature you control. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may attach it to a different non-wall creature you control.
Prevent all combat damage to equipped creature.
If equipped creature dies, destroy Paxin's Armor.

cards.name: Paxin's Shield
cards.text:
When Paxin's Shield enters the battlefield, you may attach it to any non-wall creature you control. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may attach it to a different non-wall creature you control.
Equipped creature gets +0/+4.
If equipped creature dies, destroy Paxin's Shield.

cards.name: Paxin's Shield
cards.text:
When Paxin's Sword enters the battlefield, you may attach it to any non-wall creature you control. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may attach it to a different non-wall creature you control.
Equipped creature gets +4/+0.
If equipped creature dies, destroy Paxin's Sword.

cards.name: Felice of Many Colors
cards.text:
{U}: Flying until end of turn.
{R}: +1/+0 until end of turn.
{W}: +0/+1 until end of turn.
{B}: Trample until end of turn.
{G}: Regenerate Felice of Many Colors.

cards.name: Staff of Odin
cards.text: {10}: The game is a draw.

cards.name: Unruly Summons
cards.text: Reveal the top 15 cards of target opponent's library. If exactly one creature card is revealed, put that card onto the battlefield under your control. If two or more creature cards are revealed, put one onto the battlefield under your control and one onto the battlefield under that opponent's control. Shuffle the remaining revealed cards into their owner's library.

cards.name: Brainwash
cards.text: Exile target creature you don't control. You may play that card for as long as it remains exiled. (If you play that card, it comes into play under your control.)

cards.name: Spectral Chaos
cards.text:
Switch places with target opponent. (For the rest of the game, you control that player and only you can see information in their hidden zones, and vice versa. If that player wins the game, you win instead. If you win the game, they win instead. If you or that player concedes, the conceding player loses instead.)
End the turn. (Once this spell resolves, that opponent now controls you, but nobody gets priority before this turn ends and the next turn begins.)

cards.name: Temporal Loop
cards.text:
Return all permanents to their owner's hands.
Empty all mana pools.
